attributes.action: All halal and kosher certified products are to be prominently labelled as such.
attributes.additional_details:
See Why don't Sikhs eat Halal meat? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ePhDUBWXf80.

There is even support for labelling from some sections of the Islamic community.Mohammed Sarwar of Yorkshire Poultry Producers says “Of course labelling is important. I think consumers have the right to know where the meat they are about to eat came from and how it was slaughtered, 

https://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/news/analysis/the-real-truth-about-halal-meat-1-6606159
attributes.background:
It is strictly forbidden for some Sikhs, Hindus, Buddhists and Christians to consume any halal or kosher certified product 
or religiously slaughtered meat. Without clear prominent labelling we could be consuming it without knowing. We are asking for is clear labelling to make an informed choice.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300205
